snippet: Jeff Bezos, the founder and chief executive of Amazon, has kept a low profile in politics and has said almost nothing about his interest in newspapers, except that he reads them.
abstract: Jeffrey P Bezos's purchase of The Washington Post is an astonishing move for a magnate who has kept a low profile in politics and has said almost nothing about his interest in newspapers, except that he reads them; keeping with a lot of his tech industry peers, he brings with him a sort of libertarian bent; he has provided few clues about what changes might be in store but says he will leave the day-to-day operations to others.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and DAVID STREITFELD
byline.contributor: Nick Wingfield reported from Seattle and David Streitfeld from San Francisco. Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Jeff Bezos, the founder and chief executive of Amazon, has kept a low profile in politics and has said almost nothing about his interest in newspapers, except that he reads them.

headline.main: A Mogul Gets a Landmark in the Capital
headline.print_headline: A Mogul Gets A Landmark In the Capital
